tool.name: FetchSentinel2BaselineData

param.name: in_extent
param.dialogReference:
The extent of the imagery that will be downloaded.

An extent no greater than 100 x 100 km is recommended.

param.name: out_nc
param.dialogReference: The NetCDF (i.e., data cube) containing the downloaded imagery.

param.name: in_collections
param.dialogReference:
Specifies the name(s) of the DEA collection to consider for download.

At least one is required.

param.name: in_assets
param.expression: Blue | Green | Red | Red Edge 1 | Red Edge 2 | Red Edge 3 | NIR 1 | NIR 2 | SWIR 2 | SWIR 3
param.dialogReference:
Specifies the name(s) of the DEA assets (i.e., bands) to consider for download.

At least one is required.

param.name: in_mask_algorithm
param.dialogReference:
The pixel quality mask algorithm to considered when masking invalid pixels.

See here for more information about the FMask algorithm used by DEA to derive quality mask categories, and here for the S2Cloudless algorithm.

param.name: in_quality_flags
param.dialogReference:
Specifies the pixel quality mask categories used to define valid pixels in each downloaded image.

If the FMask algorithm is requested, the selected categories will be considered valid and will not be masked out. If the S2Cloudless algorithm is used, only the valid category is considered and no choice is provided.

See here for more information about the FMask algorithm used by DEA to derive quality mask categories, and here for the S2Cloudless algorithm.

param.name: in_remove_mask
param.dialogReference: Specifies whether the pixel quality mask band will be removed after pixel masking is completed.

param.name: in_max_empty
param.dialogReference:
The maximum percentage of empty (or missing) pixels allowed in an image. Empty pixels occur when the user-defined extent extends outside of an available satellite image path or row.

If an image within the download extent has a higher percentage of empty pixels than defined here, it will be excluded from download.

param.name: in_max_invalid
param.dialogReference:
The maximum percentage of all invalid pixels categorised by the pixel quality mask allowed in an image.

If the FMask algorithm is used, only pixel quality categories not selected in the Quality Mask Flags parameter considered invalid, while the S2Cloudless algorithm will used the 'Invalid' category. If an image within the download extent has a higher percentage of invalid pixels than defined here, it will be excluded from download.

param.name: in_nodata_value
param.dialogReference: The value to set empty and invalid pixels to when applying the pixel quality mask.

param.name: in_srs
param.expression: GDA94 Australia Albers (EPSG: 3577) | WGS84 Pseudo-Mercator (EPSG: 3857) | WGS84 (EPSG: 4326)
param.dialogReference: Specifies the output spatial reference system used to project downloaded imagery.

param.name: in_res
param.dialogReference: Specifies the output spatial resolution used to resample the downloaded imagery.

param.name: in_max_threads
param.dialogReference:
The maximum number of threads allowed when downloading data.

Leaving this parameter blank will set the optimal number of threads automatically.

tool.summary:
Access DEA's Sentinel-2 Surface Reflectance Collection 3 Analysis Ready Data (ARD) product. This product offers Sentinel-2A and Sentinel-2B imagery captured since 2015 for the entirety of Australia.

This tool provides full access to the NBART corrected Sentinel-2 Collection 3 offered by DEA. The following collections and their associated metadata are outlined below:

  • Sentinel-2A (ga_s2am_ard_3) NBART (link).

  • Sentinel-2B (ga_s2bm_ard_3) NBART (link).

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Tool development by Lewis Trotter and Todd Robinson with Curtin University, Western Australia. Data provided by Digital Earth Australia.
